text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests to make something Teenage
Mutant Ninja Turtles,

because the new movie is coming out in just
a couple of days. So today

we are gonna be making something themed, we are
also gonna be making something

green, and something we’ve never made before.
We are gonna be making

Green Velvet Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
Cupcakes! Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 2 cups
of all purpose flour, 1 cup of

sugar, 1 cup of oil, 2/3 cup of buttermilk,
1 teaspoon of dark cocoa powder,

3/4 teaspoon of baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon
of salt, 1 egg, 1/2 a teaspoon

of white vinegar, 1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla
extract, 1/2 a teaspoon of

green food coloring, and 6 drops of electric
green.

And then to decorate, you’re gonna need
green buttercream frosting, I’ve

put it into a plastic baggie with a number
10 tip at the end.

Silicone baking cups, instead of the paper
liners, we’re gonna be using these

silicone ones, because then when they bake, they
will keep this color!

Googly eyes candy, light cocoa melts, and
some fondant.

We’ve got orange for Michelangelo, blue
for Leonardo, red for Raphael,
and purple for Donatello.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is whisk
together our dry ingredients

in this bowl right over here. We’re gonna
pour in your flour, cocoa, baking

soda, and salt! And we’re gonna whisk ‘em
together until it’s well combined.

Then in a large bowl we’re gonna combine our
sugar and oil, then we’re just gonna

whip together until the sugar is dissolved.
I’m just gonna be using a hand mixer.
COWABUNGA!

Alright, turn it down, turn it down, just
kidding!
Cowabunga!

Now we’re gonna add some of our wet ingredients,
we’re gonna add our egg,

our vinegar, vanilla, and buttermilk. Then
you’re gonna mix it on low

until it’s well combined. We’ve got our
wet ingredients and our dry

ingredients, and now we are gonna mix them
together, all at the same time.

You're gonna pour in all the dry. Just a
reminder, you don’t want to over-mix
this recipe, as soon as it’s combined, stop!

And, you want to mix on a low speed, so just
keep it low the whole time!
Keep it, keep it low… Keep it, keep it low…
Keepck…….

Our cake batter is now ready to turn green
I’m gonna be adding our food

coloring right now, we’re gonna fold in
our green food coloring dye

and 6 drops of electric green. This is the
color that I like, but you can make
it any green that you’d like.

Got the batter the color that I want and now
we are gonna fill our cupcake

liners. Over here I’ve lined a cupcake pan
with the different liners.

I’m just gonna take a scoop of the batter,
and you’re gonna fill each liner 2/3 full.

Our cupcakes are ready to bake, we are gonna
heat the oven to 350 degrees

and bake these for about 15 to 20 minutes,
just keep your eye on ‘em!

Once your cupcakes have baked and had plenty
of time to cool, now we are

going to level them! Over here I’ve got
a cutting board and a little serrated

knife, that’s all you need. You’re gonna
take 1 of your cupcakes and

because we’re gonna decorate their face,
we want it to be flat!

Just take your serrated knife, be careful,
don’t get your fingers!
And I’m just gonna saw back and forth.

And then here in a little plastic baggie,
again, I've just got some green buttercream

frosting with a little circle tip at the top,
I’m using a number 10, it’s

a little larger. I’m just gonna outline
our cupcake, going all the way
around to make their little face.

Then you’re gonna take a little spatula,
smooth it out.

Once you’ve frosted the top, I’m just
gonna add a little bit more frosting
for their mouth…. Pppppffffffttttt!

So it will look 3-D! The shape I’m gonna
make here is just like a little

kidney bean! Then use your icing spatula and
smooth it out just a little bit.
Do-na-new-new, new-na-new-new, new-new-new-new-new-na-new-new,

new-new-new-new-new-na-new-new, heroes in
a half-shell, Turtle Power!

Our cupcakes are frosted and now it is time
for my favorite part, it is time

to decorate! Over here I’ve got a piece
of wax paper that I’ve just

placed down so that the fondant won’t stick
to our work surface.

And, we’re gonna make some ninja masks!
That’s right!
Teenage Mutant Ninja Masks!

Got a fondant roller, I’m not… If this
was a nunchuck like Michelangelo
I wouldn’t be as good as him. He’s like….
Ohh! Here we…. See how do you?
We can find it....
Splinter’s got his work cut out for him!
We’re gonna roll out our blue fondant.

Now we’re gonna cut out a bunch of thin
rectangles, you can use a sharp

cutting knife, or I’ve got this little fondant
cutter on a wheel, kind of

looks like a pizza cutter! Which the Ninja
Turtles love!
And you just roll it, bewp-wewp-weep-weep-weep-weep-weep-weep-weep!
We’re gonna need to cut out 3 masks of every color.

And then we can make a little cut at the end,
separate ‘em, just

a little bit, then we’re gonna cross ‘em
over.

Then you’re gonna take a little metal tip,
this is a #12.

I didn’t have a cookie cutter this small,
so I'm just using this.

And we’re gonna cut out 2 holes for the
eyes.

And now we’re gonna take 2 candy eyeballs.
And we’re gonna take our

mask, line ‘em up. Now we’re gonna pick
it up together, place it on
top of your cupcake.

Here we go! His eye’s a little derpy over
here, but that’s OK!

Then you’re gonna do this to the rest of
your cupcakes!

Final decoration step is we’re gonna pipe
on their little smiles.

You can make any kind of mouth you like, but
I’m gonna make all my
turtles happy!

Here I’ve melted our light cocoa melts and I put
it into a plastic baggie

with a number 2 tip for a little bit more
control.
Oh look at him he’s like, so happy!
Ta-da!

Here are the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle Cupcakes
that we made today!

And, I am super excited you guys because this
is the first time

that we have ever made a green velvet cake
recipe!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

I’m excited for the new movie coming out,
I’ve always liked the

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series, and,
as you can see,
Michelangelo is my favorite Ninja Turtle!

Let me know in the comments below who your
favorite Ninja Turtle is, and,

if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me

know, leave me a comment down below and I
will do my best to make it happen!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of these
cupcakes on Facebook, Tumblr,
Instagram and Twitter!

And if you guys make these, please take a
picture and send it to me,

I love seeing your baking creations! I get
a big kick out of it, it makes my day!
Thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Cowabunga!
